title: I'm selling my car because of bills. What should I do? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you don’t need your car for transportation, then by all means, sell it. Vehicles are a depreciating asset. The longer you have one, the more you pay over time. There are many avenues to sell your dar. You can sell it privately on your own; you can sell it to a dealership. If you owe on your car (still paying on a loan) you will need to pay off your loan to get the title to be able to sell it. If you don’t owe anything, you can transfer the title to the new owner. Depends on your situation.

If your car is your main method of transportation, especially to get to work…. DON'T SELL IT. This will not solve your problems. HOWEVER, if the reason you are selling is because you bought a car you couldn't actually afford, then lesson learned.
